/* Support */ break up overlong sentence, add comma
/* Inherently immoral */ edit to proper format
/* Inherently immoral */ found original source, and corrected quote
/* Inherently immoral */ adding help to find quote
/* Inherently immoral */ citation added for Slizard
/* Militarily unnecessary */ Seems absurd to suggest Japan envisioned Russia, aligned against it, whom it'd trounced in RJ War, whose land it then occupied, would make for a "neutral mediator". Cite?
/* Inherently immoral */ "purposefully" included civilians... Maybe re-word that? Tough to drop an A-bomb on a country without killing civilians
/* Support */ re-work section, intro with actual dates and conditions to place the events in context
/* Support */ remove POV insight; the words speak for themselves
/* Inherently immoral */ remove POV; Camus has denounced humanity's plight, not the morality of one atomic choice
5 days after Nagasaki, so this opening was technically incorrect
/* Korean survivors */ removal of unnecessary repetition
